New Records: The Dodgers’ record-tying 33-inning postseason scoreless streak ended.
Key Match Events: Francisco Lindor hit a leadoff home run in the first at-bat.
Mark Vientos hit a grand slam in the second inning.
Max Muncy hit a solo home run in the fifth inning.
Kiké Hernández rolled into a bases-loaded double play to end the sixth inning.
Kiké Hernández flew out with two aboard to end the eighth inning.
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers decided to go with a bullpen game in Game 2 to save Walker Buehler for Game 3 in New York.
The Dodgers planned to replicate the pitching strategy that worked in Game 4 of the NL Division Series.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Dave Roberts reflected on the decision to use Landon Knack early in the game, noting it was a costly decision.
Dave Roberts mentioned the absence of key relievers Alex Vesia and Daniel Hudson as a factor in the game.
Mookie Betts expressed that they expect the series to be long and tough.
Will Smith commented on the team's depth and readiness for a longer series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers avoided using high-leverage arms outside of an 18-pitch fourth inning from Anthony Banda.
Brent Honeywell Jr. pitched three scoreless innings.
Edgardo Henriquez gave up one run over the final two innings.
The Dodgers' top three relievers will enter Game 3 on four days’ rest.
